intro: Bredia yaeyamensis, commonly known as the Yaeyama bredia, is a flowering plant native to the Yaeyama Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
